body:
what about being used here for hashing?
https://github.com/moOsama76/bevy/blob/6963b58eba4fa7d8cc73389f57699ed31a8216d4/crates/bevy_asset/src/loader.rs#L542

> what about this variable using it?

This doesn't seem to be linking to anything meta related? Not sure if I'm misunderstanding

> what about being used here for hashing?

That meta usage is the same `Box<dyn AssetMetaDyn>` that gets passed in to the loader. So instead of computing the hash based on the meta from the loaded asset, we can just store the hash based on the meta we pass in. As far as I can tell, there's no way for us to change the meta, so there's no way for the hash to be different.

issue.title: Remove the `meta` field from `LoadedAsset` and `ErasedLoadedAsset`.

labels.name: A-Assets
labels.description: Load files from disk to use for things like images, models, and sounds

labels.name: X-Contentious
labels.description: There are nontrivial implications that should be thought through

labels.name: D-Straightforward
labels.description: Simple bug fixes and API improvements, docs, test and examples

labels.name: S-Needs-Review
labels.description: Needs reviewer attention (from anyone!) to move forward

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
# Objective

Fixes #15485.

## Solution

Deletes the field! The `meta` field had no way to access or mutate it.

## Testing

- It builds!

---

## Migration Guide

- `ErasedAssetLoader` now takes a borrow to `AssetMetaDyn` instead of a `Box`.
- `LoadedAsset::new_with_dependencies` no longer requires a `meta` argument.
- `LoadContext::finish` no longer requires a `meta` argument.
